The difference as far as I understand it is that theories make a
promise th=
at the theory will pass with anything you can  pass in as
parameters (minus=
 any assumptions you make with assumeThat or
similar). That makes it possib=
le, in theory :), to generate data for
theories and find holes in them (par=
ameters where they don't pass).

A theory could be something like:

@Theory=

public void sortingAlgoritmsProduceResultsOfTheSameLengthAsTheInput(Sortin=
gAlgorithm
algorithm, List input) {
  assertThat(algorithm.sort(input).leng=
th(), is(input.length));
}

Regardless which sorting algorithm you use and =
which input you throw
at it the result should have the same length as the i=
nput.

Parameterized tests make no such claim. They will pass for the data
=
that is setup in the test but may or may not fail with other data.

Whether=
 parameterized tests will stay or go... I don't know.

Hope this helps
/J
